title.value: Reference panel-guided super-resolution inference of Hi-C data
title.justification: The title is clearly stated at the beginning of both the provided text and the article's PDF.
title.quote: Reference panel-guided super-resolution inference of Hi-C data

extractions.description: The paper introduces a new model, RefHiC-SR, which enhances the resolution of Hi-C data by using a reference panel of Hi-C datasets. The model outperforms existing tools by accurately mapping structures such as loops and topologically associating domains, especially in cases of low sequencing depths.

type.justification: The paper involves experiments comparing the performance of the RefHiC-SR model against other approaches for enhancing Hi-C data resolution, thus making it empirical research.
type.quote: We compare RefHiC-SR against tools that do not use reference samples and find that RefHiC-SR outperforms other programs across different cell types, and sequencing depths.

name.justification: The research paper is published in the Bioinformatics journal and primarily deals with computational methods related to genomic data, particularly Hi-C data.
The paper discusses Hi-C data, which is used to study the 3D genome organization and its implications on gene regulation, hence placing it under the field of Genomics.
name.quote: Accurately assessing contacts between DNA fragments inside the nucleus with Hi-C experiment is crucial for understanding the role of 3D genome organization in gene regulation.

name.justification: The model introduced by this paper is explicitly named RefHiC-SR, and is central to the research discussed.
name.quote: Here, we present RefHiC-SR, an attention-based deep learning framework that uses a reference panel of Hi-C datasets to facilitate the enhancement of Hi-C data resolution.

is_contributed.justification: The model RefHiC-SR is clearly introduced and contributed by the authors of this paper.
is_contributed.quote: Here, we present RefHiC-SR, an attention-based deep learning framework that uses a reference panel of Hi-C datasets to facilitate the enhancement of Hi-C data resolution.

is_executed.justification: Experiments using RefHiC-SR are executed to demonstrate its efficacy and compare its performance to other models.
is_executed.quote: We compare RefHiC-SR against tools that do not use reference samples and find that RefHiC-SR outperforms other programs across different cell types, and sequencing depths.

is_compared.justification: RefHiC-SR is compared against other models for enhancing Hi-C data, like HiCPlus, HiCNN, and DeepHiC.
is_compared.quote: We compare RefHiC-SR against tools that do not use reference samples and find that RefHiC-SR outperforms other programs across different cell types, and sequencing depths.

referenced_paper_title.value: Reference panel-guided topological structure annotation of Hi-c data
referenced_paper_title.justification: Though not directly mentioned as a title, RefHiC-SR builds upon previous work (RefHiC) by the authors, as cited in the document.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Here, we introduce RefHiC-SR, a model for enhancing Hi-C contact maps. While RefHiC (Zhang and Blanchette 2022), our model for topological structure annotation, is limited in its ability to learn features from large patches required in a super-resolution task.

name.justification: The model HiCPlus is mentioned as a baseline or comparative model in the paper.
name.quote: HiCPlus (Zhang et al. 2018) was the first DL-based tool proposed for this type of tasks.

is_contributed.justification: Although mentioned, HiCPlus is not introduced by this paper.
is_contributed.quote: HiCPlus (Zhang et al. 2018) was the first DL-based tool proposed for this type of tasks.

is_executed.justification: HiCPlus is executed in experiments comparing its performance with RefHiC-SR.
is_executed.quote: We first assessed the contact map enhancement performance of RefHiC-SR, in comparison to three approaches: HiCPlus, HiCNN, and DeepHiC on test Chromosomes 15–17 of GM12878 cells.

is_compared.justification: The paper compares HiCPlus' performance to RefHiC-SR and other models.
is_compared.quote: We first assessed the contact map enhancement performance of RefHiC-SR, in comparison to three approaches: HiCPlus, HiCNN, and DeepHiC on test Chromosomes 15–17 of GM12878 cells.

referenced_paper_title.value: Enhancing Hi-C data resolution with deep convolutional neural network hicplus
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced title pertains to the development of HiCPlus, which is cited and compared in the paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: HiCPlus (Zhang et al. 2018) was the first DL-based tool proposed for this type of tasks.

name.justification: The paper mentions HiC-CNN as a comparison model, highlighting its method and design.
name.quote: Later, Liu and Wang (2019) proposed a deeper CNN with resid-ual connections—HiCNN and trained it following the strategy used in HiCPlus.

is_contributed.justification: HiC-CNN is referenced as an existing model and not contributed by the authors of this paper.
is_contributed.quote: Later, Liu and Wang (2019) proposed a deeper CNN with resid-ual connections—HiCNN and trained it following the strategy used in HiCPlus.

is_executed.justification: The model HiC-CNN is executed to benchmark its performance against RefHiC-SR.
is_executed.quote: We first assessed the contact map enhancement performance of RefHiC-SR, in comparison to three approaches: HiCPlus, HiCNN, and DeepHiC on test Chromosomes 15–17 of GM12878 cells.

is_compared.justification: HiC-CNN's performance is compared alongside RefHiC-SR and other models in this study.
is_compared.quote: We first assessed the contact map enhancement performance of RefHiC-SR, in comparison to three approaches: HiCPlus, HiCNN, and DeepHiC on test Chromosomes 15–17 of GM12878 cells.

referenced_paper_title.value: HiCNN: a very deep convolutional neural network to better enhance the resolution of Hi-c data
referenced_paper_title.justification: This is the paper where HiC-CNN was introduced and it was possibly referenced as it provides the methodology of HiC-CNN.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Later, Liu and Wang (2019) proposed a deeper CNN with resid-ual connections—HiCNN and trained it following the strategy used in HiCPlus.

name.justification: DeepHiC is explicitly mentioned as one of the state-of-the-art models for the task at hand.
name.quote: DeepHiC’s discriminator is too strong to provide gradients to the generator with its original training procedure in our experiment.

is_contributed.justification: DeepHiC is a model developed by others and is not contributed by this paper.
is_contributed.quote: DeepHiC’s discriminator is too strong to provide gradients to the generator with its original training procedure in our experiment.

is_executed.justification: The paper executes DeepHiC to benchmark its performance against RefHiC-SR.
is_executed.quote: We first assessed the contact map enhancement performance of RefHiC-SR, in comparison to three approaches: HiCPlus, HiCNN, and DeepHiC on test Chromosomes 15–17 of GM12878 cells.

is_compared.justification: DeepHiC's performance is compared along with other models like RefHiC-SR for evaluating contact map enhancement.
is_compared.quote: We first assessed the contact map enhancement performance of RefHiC-SR, in comparison to three approaches: HiCPlus, HiCNN, and DeepHiC on test Chromosomes 15–17 of GM12878 cells.

referenced_paper_title.value: DeepHiC: a generative adversarial network for enhancing hi-C data resolution
referenced_paper_title.justification: DeepHiC is compared with RefHiC-SR and its methodology is discussed, implying this title is referenced.
referenced_paper_title.quote: DeepHiC’s discriminator is too strong to provide gradients to the generator with its original training procedure in our experiment.

name.justification: The dataset is extensively used for training and testing the models discussed in the paper.
name.quote: For model training, we used Hi-C data downsampled from the combined GM12878 Hi-C contact map (Rao et al. 2014).

referenced_paper_title.value: A 3D map of the human genome at kilobase resolution reveals principles of chromatin looping
referenced_paper_title.justification: The dataset is associated with the study by Rao et al. (2014), which is referenced in the paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: For model training, we used Hi-C data downsampled from the combined GM12878 Hi-C contact map (Rao et al. 2014).

name.justification: PyTorch is explicitly mentioned as the library used to implement the neural network of RefHiC-SR.
name.quote: We implemented the neural network with the PyTorch library (Paszke et al. 2019).

referenced_paper_title.value: PyTorch: An Imperative Style, High-Performance Deep Learning Library
referenced_paper_title.justification: This title corresponds with the PyTorch library reference as discussed in the paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: We implemented the neural network with the PyTorch library (Paszke et al. 2019).
